summary: This is going to sound really strange, but...  Any time I watch something starring Chris Evans, it eases my anxiety. No, this...
body:
This is going to sound really strange, but…


Any time I watch something starring Chris Evans, it eases my anxiety. No, this isn’t about having a crush on him or anything (though you’d have to be blind not to find him attractive).


You see, when I was 18, I experienced my first big heartbreak. It was my first time being in love, and I was devastated when it ended. I didn’t want to go out or see my friends, I just wanted to stay in and feel sorry for myself.


One night, I was flipping through the channels when I saw “Not Another Teen Movie” was on HBO. I watched it, and though it’s ridiculous and awful, it made me laugh. It was the exact stupid catharsis I needed.


I thought Chris was gorgeous and genuinely funny, and for some crazy reason, that made me realize that everything was going to be okay. I realized that I would (eventually) like other guys and get over my broken heart. And, of course, I did.


Over the years, I’ve read interviews where he’s open about his anxiety and depression. Knowing that someone so talented and successful has the same illnesses that I do helps, even though I’d never wish either illness on anyone (but especially not the combination).


I follow him on Twitter, and I love how outspoken he is about his beliefs. He seems to always do and say what he believes is right, and I love that. I love that he’s not just about making money….he’s genuine, and he’s deep. He really is/was the perfect choice for Captain America.


I don’t give a shit how corny that sounds. I just really fucking appreciate Chris Evans.

summary: I got this idea from watching Someone Great (I suggest watching it, it’s a good movie). There was this certain scene that just...
body:
I Love You (Chris Evans x Reader imagine)

I got this idea from watching Someone Great (I suggest watching it, it’s a good movie). There was this certain scene that just made my heart flutter and yeah-

Pairing: Chris Evans x Reader

Warning: None really, fluff?, my shitty ass rookie writing:))

Hope you guys like it♥️

•

You were sat on your coach, bundled up in a blanket burrito, scrolling through your phone. Chris was over, as always, claiming he didn’t have anything better to do at home and ended up driving to your house. It wasn’t unusual for him to be at your house, in fact he was always at your house. It’s like a second home to him, he had some spare clothes hidden in the guest bedroom (although some of his hoodies somehow made its way into your closet, don’t know why lol), and some of his favorite snacks were stashed in your kitchen cabinets.

You and Chris have been friends for a good few years. You guys met on the set of the first Avengers movie. After RDJ introduced you to each other, you guys hit it off, starting a friendship that would last a long time. You’d be lying if you said you didn’t have feelings for him. But you did, and you couldn’t help it. Chris is just an amazing guy with the most purest personality, who was also a mix of dork and frat boy. Little did you know, he was feeling the same.

Chris stared at you from across the room. You were going through your phone, your eyebrows crinkled together. He loved the way your hair was pulled to one side and fell so naturally against your neck.

“You wanna order some food? I’d suggest cooking, but that ended badly the last time we tried it.” You asked glancing up from your phone. Before you looked at him, Chris moved his gaze to the tv, which was playing some new show you were obsessed with.

Chris chuckled as he remembered the big mess you two left in your kitchen. “Yeah, that’s a smart idea.”

You tapped the Uber Eats app and opened it up. “So, what are we in the mood for Christopher? Chinese? Mexican? Ooo, how about some good ol’ McDonald’s? Jennifer mentioned this restaurant with some kickass Italian food, should we try it out?” You kept on suggesting things waiting for Chris’s reply. But you were met with silence. You looked up and saw Chris gazing at you from the other couch across from you. He was leaning back on one of his arms with his legs resting on the couch.

“What?” You asked playfully, squinting your eyes at him. “Is there something on my face?” You asked again. A smile formed onto his lips as he shook his head.

“No. I-I just-“ he stuttered out, struggling a bit with his words. Your phone’s screen dimmed as you waited for him to finish his sentence.

“I love you.” He blurted out. You were taken aback by his sudden confession. Your mouth gaped as you stared back at him.

“Oh- wow.” You managed to let out. You couldn’t believe it, Chris just said he loved you. But your mind was all over the place. Did he mean it as a friend? Or did he mean that he loves you loves you? Like as in relationship wise.

Chris got up from his seat and ran a hand through his hair, and scratched his his newly grown beard. “I was just- I mean- Ah fahk that was stupid.” He said, his Boston accent slipping out. He squeezed his eyes shut as if he were trying to make himself disappear from the situation. He opened his eyes and shook himself a bit, and sent you a reassuring smile. Besides your current situation, you thought he looked adorable when he was all flustered and embarrassed.

“No- I don’t love you.” He said pointing at you.

“What?” You asked, a bit confused. Your heart felt like it was falling out of your body.

“NO! I mean-“He yelled out after seeing your face drop.

“I do love you! Yeah, I do, I love you a lot- Ah shit.” He groaned throwing both his hands and head back. A soft smile made its way to your lips. “You’re, you’re doing great.” You assured him.

“I just- that was unexpected. I don’t know what to-“ you explained but Chris cut you off.

“It’s fine, really. You know what? You order the food, and I’ll be in the bathroom. Yeah.” He confirmed before rushing to your bathroom. When you heard the door shut you sat back into your couch with a stupid grin on your face. You bit your bottom lip, trying to stop, but your face wouldn’t allow you. Your stomach felt like there was a zoo of butterflies let loose in it and you felt like you were on cloud 9.

“Oh my god.” You breathed out as you shoved a pillow onto your face before squealing into it. He just said he loved you. What the hell are you doing on the couch, tell him you love him dumbass, your inner conscience yelled at yourself. You hopped up from your spot and ran to your bathroom.

“Fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck. You stupid asshole, you can’t just say that to her out of no where. God, you screwed it up. You meatball, you screwed everything up with her.” You heard Chris whisper harshly to himself. You heard somthing getting hit, making you more concerned to what was happening inside.

You took a deep breath and knocked on the door. The footsteps inside came to a halt.

“Yeah?”

“Can you open the door?”

“No?” He answered, his voice a bit pitched.

“Christopher Robert Evans, this is my house.” You heard the door unlock. The door opened and revealed Chris. He forehead looked a bit red.

“Hey.” He greeted you, his shoulders a bit tensed. You smiled and leaned against the door way.

“Hi. Quite a show you put on back there.” He groaned and placed his head against the door.

“Look. I know it came out of no where, but I’ve loved you for a long ass time. And I’ve been such a pussy because it took me this long to tell you and I fucked it up. I just like you a lot. You’re so caring and nice to everybody. But you’re also independent and you don’t let anybody stop you from doing things you want to do. And I admire you for that. You’re just- you. And I love every little thing about you.” He confessed.

“I love you too.” You answered. There’s wasn’t anything left to say, technically you were speechless, the man you loved just admitted that he loved you back. But you ended up saying what you’ve always wanted to tell him. The two of you just stood there staring at each other.

“C’mere you.” Chris muttered and grabbed you by the waist. Your hands locked around his neck. He brushed a few strands of hair off your face before leaning in. You closed your eyes and met him in the middle. The kiss was soft, gentle even, but full of emotion.

“God, I’ve wanted to do for such a long time.” Chris breathed out after you two broke your kiss.

You glanced at his forehead, “Are you sure you don’t want any ice for that?”

“Nah, but a kiss’ll do.” He winked leaning forward to your face.

•

I hope you guys liked this. I know my writing is a bit iffy, bear with me please I’m trying my best out here.

It wasn’t unusual for him to be at your house, in fact he was always at your house. It’s like a second home to him, he had some spare clothes hidden in the guest bedroom (although some of his hoodies somehow made its way into your closet, don’t know why lol), and some of his favorite snacks were stashed in your kitchen cabinets.

You and Chris have been friends for a good few years. You guys met on the set of the first Avengers movie. After RDJ introduced you to each other, you guys hit it off, starting a friendship that would last a long time. You’d be lying if you said you didn’t have feelings for him. But you did, and you couldn’t help it. Chris is just an amazing guy with the most purest personality, who was also a mix of dork and frat boy. Little did you know, he was feeling the same.

Chris stared at you from across the room. You were going through your phone, your eyebrows crinkled together. He loved the way your hair was pulled to one side and fell so naturally against your neck.

“You wanna order some food? I’d suggest cooking, but that ended badly the last time we tried it.” You asked glancing up from your phone. Before you looked at him, Chris moved his gaze to the tv, which was playing some new show you were obsessed with.

Chris chuckled as he remembered the big mess you two left in your kitchen. “Yeah, that’s a smart idea.”

You tapped the Uber Eats app and opened it up. “So, what are we in the mood for Christopher? Chinese? Mexican? Ooo, how about some good ol’ McDonald’s? Jennifer mentioned this restaurant with some kickass Italian food, should we try it out?” You kept on suggesting things waiting for Chris’s reply. But you were met with silence. You looked up and saw Chris gazing at you from the other couch across from you. He was leaning back on one of his arms with his legs resting on the couch.

“What?” You asked playfully, squinting your eyes at him. “Is there something on my face?” You asked again. A smile formed onto his lips as he shook his head.

“No. I-I just-“ he stuttered out, struggling a bit with his words. Your phone’s screen dimmed as you waited for him to finish his sentence.

“I love you.” He blurted out. You were taken aback by his sudden confession. Your mouth gaped as you stared back at him.

“Oh- wow.” You managed to let out. You couldn’t believe it, Chris just said he loved you. But your mind was all over the place. Did he mean it as a friend? Or did he mean that he loves you loves you? Like as in relationship wise.

Chris got up from his seat and ran a hand through his hair, and scratched his his newly grown beard. “I was just- I mean- Ah fahk that was stupid.” He said, his Boston accent slipping out. He squeezed his eyes shut as if he were trying to make himself disappear from the situation. He opened his eyes and shook himself a bit, and sent you a reassuring smile. Besides your current situation, you thought he looked adorable when he was all flustered and embarrassed.

“No- I don’t love you.” He said pointing at you.

“What?” You asked, a bit confused. Your heart felt like it was falling out of your body.

“NO! I mean-“He yelled out after seeing your face drop.

“I do love you! Yeah, I do, I love you a lot- Ah shit.” He groaned throwing both his hands and head back. A soft smile made its way to your lips. “You’re, you’re doing great.” You assured him.

“I just- that was unexpected. I don’t know what to-“ you explained but Chris cut you off.

“It’s fine, really. You know what? You order the food, and I’ll be in the bathroom. Yeah.” He confirmed before rushing to your bathroom. When you heard the door shut you sat back into your couch with a stupid grin on your face. You bit your bottom lip, trying to stop, but your face wouldn’t allow you. Your stomach felt like there was a zoo of butterflies let loose in it and you felt like you were on cloud 9.

“Oh my god.” You breathed out as you shoved a pillow onto your face before squealing into it. He just said he loved you. What the hell are you doing on the couch, tell him you love him dumbass, your inner conscience yelled at yourself. You hopped up from your spot and ran to your bathroom.

“I love you too.” You answered. There’s wasn’t anything left to say, technically you were speechless, the man you loved just admitted that he loved you back. But you ended up saying what you’ve always wanted to tell him. The two of you just stood there staring at each other.
